component.name: minio
component.title: Minio
component.description: Store and retrieve objects from Minio Storage Service using Minio SDK.
component.label: cloud,file

autoCreateBucket.label: common
autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket if bucket name not exist.

customHttpClient.label: common
customHttpClient.description: Set custom HTTP client for authenticated access.

endpoint.label: common
endpoint.description: Endpoint can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.

minioClient.label: common
minioClient.description: Reference to a Minio Client object in the registry.

policy.label: common
policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the method.

proxyPort.label: common
proxyPort.description: TCP/IP port number. 80 and 443 are used as defaults for HTTP and HTTPS.

region.label: common
region.description: The region in which Minio client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

secure.label: common
secure.description: Flag to indicate to use secure connection to minio service or not.

serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey.label: common
serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey.description: Server-side encryption for source object while copy/move objects.

autoCloseBody.label: consumer
autoCloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is true, then the MinioObject.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

bypassGovernanceMode.label: consumer
bypassGovernanceMode.description: Set this flag if you want to bypassGovernanceMode when deleting a particular object.

deleteAfterRead.label: consumer
deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from Minio after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the MinioConstants#BUCKET_NAME and MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME headers, or only the MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME header.

delimiter.label: consumer
delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

includeBody.label: consumer
includeBody.description: If it is true, the exchange body will be set to a stream to the contents of the file. If false, the headers will be set with the Minio object metadata, but the body will be null. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.

includeFolders.label: consumer
includeFolders.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to set include folders.

includeUserMetadata.label: consumer
includeUserMetadata.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with user meta data.

includeVersions.label: consumer
includeVersions.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with versioning.

length.label: consumer
length.description: Number of bytes of object data from offset.

matchETag.label: consumer
matchETag.description: Set match ETag parameter for get object(s).

maxConnections.label: consumer
maxConnections.description: Set the maxConnections parameter in the minio client configuration

maxMessagesPerPoll.label: consumer
maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. The default value is 10. Use 0 or a negative number to set it as unlimited.

modifiedSince.label: consumer
modifiedSince.description: Set modified since parameter for get object(s).

moveAfterRead.label: consumer
moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

notMatchETag.label: consumer
notMatchETag.description: Set not match ETag parameter for get object(s).

objectName.label: consumer
objectName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given object name.

offset.label: consumer
offset.description: Start byte position of object data.

recursive.label: consumer
recursive.description: List recursively than directory structure emulation.

startAfter.label: consumer
startAfter.description: list objects in bucket after this object name.

unModifiedSince.label: consumer
unModifiedSince.description: Set un modified since parameter for get object(s).

useVersion1.label: consumer
useVersion1.description: when true, version 1 of REST API is used.

versionId.label: consumer
versionId.description: Set specific version_ID of a object when deleting the object.

deleteAfterWrite.label: producer
deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the Minio file has been uploaded.

keyName.label: producer
keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

operation.label: producer
operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload.

pojoRequest.label: producer
pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not.

storageClass.label: producer
storageClass.description: The storage class to set in the request.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

accessKey.label: security
accessKey.description: Amazon AWS Secret Access Key or Minio Access Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

secretKey.label: security
secretKey.description: Amazon AWS Access Key Id or Minio Secret Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

autoCreateBucket.label: common
autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket if bucket name not exist.

customHttpClient.label: common
customHttpClient.description: Set custom HTTP client for authenticated access.

endpoint.label: common
endpoint.description: Endpoint can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.

minioClient.label: common
minioClient.description: Reference to a Minio Client object in the registry.

policy.label: common
policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the method.

proxyPort.label: common
proxyPort.description: TCP/IP port number. 80 and 443 are used as defaults for HTTP and HTTPS.

region.label: common
region.description: The region in which Minio client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

secure.label: common
secure.description: Flag to indicate to use secure connection to minio service or not.

serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey.label: common
serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey.description: Server-side encryption for source object while copy/move objects.

autoCloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is true, then the MinioObject.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

bypassGovernanceMode.label: consumer
bypassGovernanceMode.description: Set this flag if you want to bypassGovernanceMode when deleting a particular object.

deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from Minio after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the MinioConstants#BUCKET_NAME and MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME headers, or only the MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME header.

delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

includeBody.description: If it is true, the exchange body will be set to a stream to the contents of the file. If false, the headers will be set with the Minio object metadata, but the body will be null. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.

includeFolders.label: consumer
includeFolders.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to set include folders.

includeUserMetadata.label: consumer
includeUserMetadata.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with user meta data.

includeVersions.label: consumer
includeVersions.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with versioning.

length.label: consumer
length.description: Number of bytes of object data from offset.

matchETag.label: consumer
matchETag.description: Set match ETag parameter for get object(s).

maxConnections.label: consumer
maxConnections.description: Set the maxConnections parameter in the minio client configuration

maxMessagesPerPoll.label: consumer
maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. The default value is 10. Use 0 or a negative number to set it as unlimited.

modifiedSince.label: consumer
modifiedSince.description: Set modified since parameter for get object(s).

moveAfterRead.label: consumer
moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

notMatchETag.label: consumer
notMatchETag.description: Set not match ETag parameter for get object(s).

objectName.label: consumer
objectName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given object name.

offset.label: consumer
offset.description: Start byte position of object data.

recursive.label: consumer
recursive.description: List recursively than directory structure emulation.

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

startAfter.label: consumer
startAfter.description: list objects in bucket after this object name.

unModifiedSince.label: consumer
unModifiedSince.description: Set un modified since parameter for get object(s).

useVersion1.label: consumer
useVersion1.description: when true, version 1 of REST API is used.

versionId.label: consumer
versionId.description: Set specific version_ID of a object when deleting the object.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

deleteAfterWrite.label: producer
deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the Minio file has been uploaded.

keyName.label: producer
keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

operation.label: producer
operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload.

pojoRequest.label: producer
pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not.

storageClass.label: producer
storageClass.description: The storage class to set in the request.

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

accessKey.label: security
accessKey.description: Amazon AWS Secret Access Key or Minio Access Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

secretKey.label: security
secretKey.description: Amazon AWS Access Key Id or Minio Secret Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.
